Valued at $22 billion in 2022, Byju's has seen its fortunes almost wiped out due to a massive cash crunch, regulatory issues and disputes with investors

4 min read Last Updated : Apr 09 2025 | 12:50 AM IST

Byju Raveendran, founder of the embattled edtech firm Byju’s, has filed a police complaint against the former insolvency resolution professional (RP) of its bankrupt parent company, a trustee representing US lenders, and some employees of consulting firm EY.

“FIR filed against those involved in a criminal conspiracy against BYJU'S: Pankaj, the RP who illegally handed over the insolvency process to Dinkar, Rahul & Lokesh from EY who are the agents of GLAS, a collective of crooks.
